pr_title: KAFKA-10618: Add UUID class, use in protocols

timeline.message: Updated so that protocol uses kafka version of UUID class.
Merge branch 'trunk' of github.com:apache/kafka into KIP516UUID
Merge branch 'trunk' of github.com:apache/kafka into KIP516UUID

timeline.bodyText: We have already imported UUID, do we need to qualify here? I can see it was this way before, but not sure why.
timeline.author: rajinisivaram

replies.bodyText: My best guess is that since the type is also called UUID, originally the qualification was to differentiate. But it doesn't seem to be needed, so I'll update this to just say UUID.
replies.author: jolshan

timeline.bodyText: Same as before, why don't we just use UUID since package was imported?
timeline.author: rajinisivaram

timeline.bodyText: Should we have a separate unit test for UUID.randomUUID to verify it is not zero or the sentinel?
timeline.author: rajinisivaram

replies.bodyText: I thought about that, but since the likelihood we would get the zero/sentinel id is so low even if they were allowed, I didn't know if the test would be useful. The sentinel ID is also a private variable, but I suppose I could just construct a new one if we want to test.
replies.author: jolshan

timeline.message: Added test for random UUID, simplified UUID in Type.java
Updated class description comment to match formats of other classes in package.
